definition: (a product) sells well/to be in demand
to walk/to go/to run/to move (of vehicle)/to visit/to leave/to go away/to die (euph.)/from/through/away (in compound verbs, such as 撤走[che4 zou3])/to change (shape, form, meaning)
good-looking/charming/(of goods) in great demand/(coll.) to season (food)

sentences.english: All the foreign luxury brands sell well in China.
sentences.chinese: 所有的國外的奢侈品牌都在中國很走俏。

sentences.english: The book was making a hit, that was evident.
Multifunctional videorecorders have enjoyed brick sales.
sentences.chinese: 多功能錄像機一直在市場走俏。

sentences.english: Accounting and finance grads will be in demand too, the poll says.
sentences.chinese: 該項調研還顯示，會計與金融專業的畢業生也將走俏。

sentences.english: Why adulterated milk popular, do not adulterate the milk but nobody wanted?
sentences.chinese: 爲什麼摻假的牛奶走俏，不摻假的鮮奶反而沒人要？

sentences.english: High-grade cosmetics are selling well in Vietnam despite their high prices.
sentences.chinese: 高檔化妝品走俏越南儘管其價格高。

sentences.english: Outbound tourism is popular during the 7-day Golden Week Holiday this year.
sentences.chinese: 今年國慶黃金週，全國各地出境旅遊都頗爲走俏。

definition: to sell strongly/to be in great demand
a craze/a popular wave/a hit with the public
current favorite/the latest thing/darling (of the market or the media etc)
delicious cakes/popular person/sth that is in high demand
to chase after (a popular person or item)/to pursue/popularity
